In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can do it using the DataFrames package in Julia.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((dt)->Dates.year(dt)*100 + Dates.month(dt), df[:dt])
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `:ym`. The values in this new column are calculated by applying the anonymous function to each value in the `:dt` column of the DataFrame. This function extracts the year and month from the DateTime, multiplies them together (to combine into "yyyymm" format), and assigns it to the new column `:ym`.
